column5: Well that's a big body of water! We decided to launch out of Belle River based on Lew's advice. If you read my other post I was fishing for St Clair musky for the first time, and trying to get a friend his first ever.  Looked at a map and saw a shallow point stretching out not too far from the launch so we decided to try over there. Never having been there, I decided to troll over to see if we could find any structure...not really. Now I like to troll fast. I tied on a shallow raider in firetiger flavour for my buddy and started to troll at a healthy pace (6.5 to 7 mph). Couldn't have been in the water 15 seconds when the rod buckles (it will do that at 6.5 mph!). What a start to the day. Just a little guy at around 32 inches but when its your first its a giant! We eventually found a weedy hump, and my buddy found out what a real musky looks like! Nailed this 46 incher and he was shaking the rest of the day    I finally got in on the action with a 36 and a 44 (or so) that we lost at boatside. Had one more rip that didn't hook up. We have a new musky addict in the fold!
Nice!!!!  I love the colours of those St.Clair fish!
Awesome stuff Roger!  Glad there were no smallmouth there to mess with your troll.
haha...did stop once to cast and had lots of smallies follow my sledge but no takers. Couldn't cast too long because my buddy just had a surgery and was still tender
nice going.  Nothing like success on some new water, targeting a new species.
You love all of the colours, you just can't eat them! Lol .Next weekend I'll  get a few kids between 2 and 6 Holdinga rods, in a small pond, they can't wait.  Nice catch Rizzo.
You did great. Nice looking fish. I've been out of Belle River 3 times now and have never caught one.
Excellent 1st day on the water Roger and congrats to your bud on a real nice fish.
Excellent day on water you never fished before.    Congrats to you both
congrats. I am glad the lake gave you some action. some days she can humble you. st clairs my home water.. with 96.5 release theres an amazing fishery for all that respect her bounty.
A really nice outing for you Roger. Congrats to you and your friend.
awesome job! some nice fish for your first outing. knew i shoulda been out there last night instead of trying to fish in this rain today
Nice catch boys...  Multiple musky days are good anywhere....
Beauty fish!
great looking fish.  Glad you got your buddy his first musky!
Great stuff Rog.  Your buddy will be bugging you to get out there every weekend now
I've never fished it but am dying to... I'm seriously thinking about storing my boat there for a season to learn it.  Awesome work, especially for your first time there!!
Well done Roger. We need to hookup soon!
nice going
Good show Rizzo!
Great fish - thanks for sharing
Congrats Roger I'll bet they'll be no more dragging your feet to get to LSC, it's a great fishery
